title: One for All would be so much better if we could choose our champs

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body:
When I first heard of this game mode I was very excited to try it with Singed. I thought it would be super fun! 

Then I realized that the only way I could play singed is if I queued with at least 2 other people who wanted to play singed - but this was not ideal since the other 2 random people have likely never played singed before, and thus 1. wouldn't know how to play him, and 2. would be mad that they were forced to play singed and might just troll and int.

And the enemy team has the same issue: likely 1-2 people on the enemy team know their champions very well, and the rest are just feeding their asses off like i did in my riven game yesterday.

The result of all this is some very sub-par gameplay. If I am queued up with 5 singed mains, we dominate and win super hard. If I am playing with people who don't main singed the game is a mess and is likewise not very fun.

So please, Rito, make it so we can choose the champion we want to play in one-for-all mode, and then queue us up with other people who want to play that same champion. This would make for much more interesting and fun games, and we could actually test which match-ups favour which champions, instead of just seeing if the 1 person who mains the champion on their team can carry harder than the other person on the opposing team.

replies.body: When you say "choose the champion we want to play in one-for-all mode, and then queue us up with other people who want to play that same champion", wouldn't that take a long time? What if someone wanted to play Yorick or Singed but no one else was queueing with that champ?
personally i would prefer to wait the 20 mins or whatever, rather than having a shitty game. or not even being able to play singed at all.

Well then you can also just have fill and they would probably find games rather quickly

Not necessarily. There are some people out there who can play almost every champion to a decent degree. They know the basics of each champ, and can perform just fine in a "just for fun" setting such as One for All.

I say this because I was one of these people before Team Builder and our current Roll Selection came along. We only had blind draft, and down in the lower elos, you had to be able to play every role to a decent degree to climb. As long as the champ didn't require REALLY good mechanics (i.e. Yasuo, Azir, or Riven)......I could play them.
It's an optional game mode no one is required to play so they should know full well they are getting into a long queue time. Also, as stated below, there could always be a fill option.

I'm fairly certain that more people would prefer the current form instead of the one as suggested in this thread. Game modes should be fun for as many people as possible; look at why they decided to release ARURF.
